Package nl.rug.aoop.asteroids.control

Class PlayerKeyListener

java.lang.Object
nl.rug.aoop.asteroids.control.PlayerKeyListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener
public class PlayerKeyListener extends Object implements KeyListener
This class is responsible for handling keyboard input for a single player that is bound to a ship.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static int
    ACCELERATION_KEY
    The key that, when pressed, causes the ship to accelerate.
    static int
    FIRE_WEAPON_KEY
    The key that causes the ship to fire its weapon.
    static int
    LEFT_KEY
    The key that turns the ship left, or counter-clockwise.
    static int
    RIGHT_KEY
    The key that turns the ship right, or clockwise.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PlayerKeyListener​(Spaceship ship, Client client)
    Constructs a new player key listener to control the given ship.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    keyPressed​(KeyEvent event)
    This method is invoked when a key is pressed and sets the corresponding fields in the spaceship to true.
    void
    keyReleased​(KeyEvent event)
    This method is invoked when a key is released and sets the corresponding fields in the spaceship to false.
    void
    keyTyped​(KeyEvent event)
    This method doesn't do anything, but we must provide an empty implementation to satisfy the contract of the KeyListener interface.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed​(KeyEvent event)
      This method is invoked when a key is pressed and sets the corresponding fields in the spaceship to true.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      event - Key event that triggered the method.

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased​(KeyEvent event)
      This method is invoked when a key is released and sets the corresponding fields in the spaceship to false.
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      event - Key event that triggered the method.

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped​(KeyEvent event)
      This method doesn't do anything, but we must provide an empty implementation to satisfy the contract of the KeyListener interface.
      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      event - Key event that triggered the method.
